intro: Erysimum neumannii, commonly known as the Neumann's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known garden plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Erysimum neumannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
